reviews.review:
Отличное время провождение,особенно,если с друзьями.Садишься,включаешь и тут понеслось...
Очень затягивает,вроде сел "партейку скатать",а смотришь - прошло часа 3.Про перки ничего сказать не могу,они здесь не основное,а основное здесь именно Кооператив.Не пытайтесь получить полный спектр удовольствий от игры не поиграв с другими людьми-напарниками!Именно в этой игре реализован,что называется "teamplay"!Товарищ может подлечить,когда вас ранили,поможет заварить дверь,чтобы злобные твари некоторое время не могли обойти вас,скажем с тыла,даже может деньжат подкинуть,если вам вдруг не хватает на "Калаш",да и просто спину прикроет.С другой стороны,если вы будете играть один,то и монстров соответственно будет меньше.Как пример:играете вы вдвоём с другом,на второй волне у вас может быть,ну скажем 50 - 60 монстров (к примеру),а если бы вас было не двое,а шестеро,то и монстров уже было бы 100! 
Хочу отметить,что музыка в игру просто 10/10! Нереально заряжает!Именно музыка создаёт 70% всей атмосферы игры.Самое главное,что вы должные зделать-это выкрутить настройки музыки на МАХ!
ну и в заключении скажу,что игра стоит своих денег,обязательно купите,проведёте как минимун пару-тройку вечеров очень и очень весело!:)
Great fun, I personally like it more than L4D2. No a single player game though, its much better with friends

Il s'agit d'un fps en coop, de 1 à 6 joueurs qui doivent survivre à des vagues de sortes de clones mutants de différents types appelés Zeds. A l'origine mod de Unreal Tournament 2004, devenu un véritable stand alone en 2009, le moteur physique du jeu est cependant peut être un peu arrièré désormais et peut paraître inadapté aujourd'hui, notamment en ce qui concerne les déplacements des joueurs, la hitbox difficilement appréhendable de la tête et la localisation des dégats approximative, mais l'annonce de Killing Floor 2 et ses prétentions sont réellement prometteuse. Le jeu s'accroît rapidement en difficulté et il est possible mais difficile d'y jouer seul. Malgré celà, ce jeu, l'ambiance de ce jeu, ses features, son arsenal, sa bande son métal particulièrement à sa place, sont réellement appréciables et la richesse de son gameplay n'a d'égal que sa pratique jubilatoire, son aspect défoulant, grisant, le challenge qu'il représente dans les niveaux de difficultés plus élevés, c'est une décharge d'action intense, d'adrénaline, une bouffée d'air qui ridiculise le fun et la durée de vie des fps modernes, ce jeu à 5 ans au moment où j'écris cette review et le mod dont il est à l'origine en a 9 et pourtant il s'agit d'un des jeux que j'ai le plus apprécié de tout les temps et sur lequel je me suis le plus amusé, toutes plateformes confondues, si ce n'est pas le premier. Si vous n'avez pas essayé ce jeu avec un ami au moins une fois dans vôtre vie, il manque quelque chose dans vôtre expérience du divertissement. Sérieusement.

Killing Floor is a great zombie survival game which does not have the attributes which some don't like about the zombies from Call of Duty, this zombie survival game has an end to it.

The game has multiple difficulties to choose from as well as multiple perks to enhance different play styles.  The perks enhance things such as explosive damage, headshot damage multiplier, shotgun damage and many other things.  Each perk of course can be levelled up so that the perk offers more enhancements to the specific playstyle, such as the support specialist is a perk that enhances the stats for shotgun users, the perk levels up from weld points which are gained from welding and unwelding doors and of course the other portion of levelling up the perk is gained from distributing damage with shotguns.  Once perks are levelled up to level 5 and 6 bonuses are added alongside the perk such as starting weapons and possibly armor.

There are multiple maps to choose form while playing Killing Floor and each game played consists of 10 waves and a final boss wave.  The boss is a zombie called The Patriarch.
In this game there are multiple types of zombies instead of just one type which other games tend to stick with, each zombie is a different styled zombie varying in strength and agility.
Overall this game has a lot of different aspects to it and is a very enjoyable game which has a lot of replay value in it and I recommend it to any survival horror game enthusiast.

Killing floor is like the CoD series zombies. but with a slightly nore defined storyline and even objectives in some game modes although you do feel left out with the somewhat limited amount of guns you start out with. the game advertises lots of mini DLC and its all verry tempting. but overall its an amazing game and i wish you guys would buy it!

I used to obsess over this game.
This is my 2nd favorite Co-Op survival horror game (Left 4 Dead 1 being my favorite). I also got my name from my favorite chracter in the game, Mr. Foster. This game is loads of fun and can be funny at times. Gore, blood, weapons, and more weapons.
Just make sure you have looadsamoney.
It is a fun first person shooter, also has a good multiplayer feature. Beginner allows me to enjoy the game with limited skill.

Pros: British as fuck shooter from 2006. Graphics have held up really well. Gameplay starts off slow, but quickly ramps up (depends on how many noobs/difficulty you're on.) Awesome progression for classes. Just the right amount of guns to make the game in depth, but not so many that you don't know what to get.

Cons: lots of DLC only items to make you spend more money, along with characters that only add an ingame model and no voice overs (with a few exceptions). Lags at the start of each round (unless you own a pc that costs over $2500 and you built it yourself, doesnt really mean much though)

so i had this friend in high school who was the only person who would play video games with me but he was a kinda mean and better at games than me and we played killing floor a lot so i get stressed when i play it.

This game is cheap, easy to learn, has multiple classes to suit your playing style, intense battles and most importantly; it's fun! 
The only thing this game lacks is some graphical upgrades and maybe somesort of campaing mode, but when you are aiming down sights with 70 zombies rushing towards you like a tidal wave of blood, meat, guts and unspeakable fluids the last thing on your mind is gonna be the texture quality and the lore of all this. 

Though its almost a must to have 1 - 5 firends in a skype call to play with, that makes the experience much much better. 
Playing with randoms online can become a little frustrating at times but is most of the time "ok" compared to having friends to play with. 

I give it a 8/10, you can log a whole lot of hours on this game, definatly worth the price.
Still good. Alway a lot of Fun.

Killing Floor is probably one of the best multiplayer co-op games out there.  With the usual small caveat of "as long as your team works as a team".  Killing Floor is a VERY team-centric game, and while there may be people out there who boast they can solo maps while leaving their teams in the dust, that just doesn't fly in the higher difficulty settings, where the game really expects you all to pull together and perform your chosen roles.

There's no room for "let's all go as the same class" a good part of the time.  You WILL encounter monsters that are resistant to the damage your class specializes in, and your limited ammo will end up being chewed up way too fast.  There's no room for "I'll  just go lone wolf" most of the time, since the game will [b]happily[/b] spawn groups of monsters on top of anyone who decides to Rambo their way through a stage, ala [i]Left 4 Dead 1/2[/i].  There's no room to not have a medic and/or support in any game with 3 or more people playing, since you'll end up facing waves of critters that will tear 1/4 of your health off of you at a time.

If you pull together as a team, and watch out for each other, you can roll over most anything.  Hoarding cash is frowned upon, since you can only hold so much, and throwing cash out to put more tools in the hands of your teammates can only help you in the long run.  Watching each other's backs becomes much more effective than simply focusing on your fronts.

Overall, it's a really well put together game, and a must for anyone who enjoys "let's all cling togther" type action/survival games.  It's got a pretty decent modding/mapmaking community, too, and that's really helped the game last for as long as it has.
